DataElement.preferredName: Dose-Limiting Adverse Event Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator of yes/no related to result of unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with side effects of a drug.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to result of unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with side effects of a drug.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Describes side effects of a drug or other treatment that are serious enough to prevent an increase in dose or level of that treatment.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Describes side effects of a drug or other treatment that are serious enough to prevent an increase in dose or level of that treatment.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Dose limiting toxicity
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose limiting toxicity

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade 3 or 4 non-hematologic toxicity that does not resolve to baseline level after delaying the next dose by more than 2 weeks

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient experience any drug-related dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) that were defined in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the adverse event a dose-limiting toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was there dose limiting toxicity this cycle?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience a Hematologic DLT during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a total of 2 or more DLTs since start of EPI Block 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade 3 alanine aminotransferase increased lasting longer than 4 consecutive days or a 2 grade increase from baseline

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade 3 platelet count decreased associated with a grade greater than or equal to 3 bleeding event

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade 3 electrocardiogram QT corrected interval prolonged with QTc interval greater than or equal to 501 msec on at least two separate ECGs

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade greater than or equal to 2 blood bilirubin increased lasting longer than 14 consecutive days

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade 3 vomiting lasting longer than 48 hours despite optimal antiemetic therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade 3 diarrhea lasting longer than 48 hours despite optimal antidiarrheal therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a dose-limiting toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade 2 alanine aminotransferase increased and associated with a grade greater than or equal to 2 bilirubin elevation of any duration in the absence of liver metastases, a 2 grade increase from baseline, or not related to the patient's underlying malignancy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade 4 alkaline phosphatase increased lasting longer than 7 consecutive days

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Grade 4 neutrophil count decreased lasting longer than 7 consecutive days

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any other Grade 3 or higher adverse event

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience a dose-limiting toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the adverse event a dose limiting toxicity (DLT)?

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
